perturbation.original_text:
1.1      "Maximum Daily Delivery Obligation (MDDO)" means the maximum                   daily quantity of natural gas, expressed in Dekatherms (Dth),                   that Transporter is obligated to deliver from time to time at                   the Point(s) of Delivery specified in Exhibit B to the                   executed Agreement.

         1.2      "Maximum Daily Quantity (MDQ) " means the maximum daily                   quantity of natural gas, expressed* in Dth's, that Transporter                   is obligated under the executed Agreement to transport on                   behalf of' Shipper, which shall be 23,000 Dth.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.1      "Maximum Daily Delivery Obligation (MDDO)" means a quantity of natural gas that Transporter delivers at the Point(s) of Delivery specified in Exhibit B to the executed Agreement.

         1.2      "Maximum Daily Quantity (MDQ) " means the maximum quantity of natural gas that Transporter is obligated under the executed Agreement to transport on behalf of' Shipper, which shall be 23,000 Dth.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "expressed in Dekatherms (Dth)," from the MDDO definition, and by further modifying the language to be generally descriptive and non-specific as to measurement, creates ambiguity and contradiction. The MDQ is explicitly defined in Dth, but the MDDO lacks this, potentially leading to disputes over measurement units even though Exhibit B uses 'Dth/d'.

perturbation.original_text:
4.  Bid Evaluation Methodology: i) highest rate, net revenue or present          value

         ii).     If Releasing Shipper chooses to provide weighting factors in                   accordance with Section 14.9 of the General Terms and                   Conditions of Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff, weighting factors                   are as follows: Please provide a range for each factor between                   0 - 1,000. The numbers need not add up to 1,000.

                  _________________ Volume (0 - 1,000)

                  Max Rate ___________________ -1 Rate (0 - 1,000)
perturbation.changed_text:
4.  Bid Evaluation Methodology: Releasing Shipper will provide weighting factors in accordance with Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff.

                  _________________ Volume

                  Max Rate ___________________ -1 Rate
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'highest rate, net revenue or present value', the methodology for bid evaluation becomes unclear and less comprehensive, potentially leading to arbitrary decisions. Omitting the instruction to 'Please provide a range for each factor between 0 - 1,000. The numbers need not add up to 1,000' introduces an omission creating inconsistency between the statement about weighting factors and the practical implementation as there is no guidance.
perturbation.location: FORM OF NOTICE OF PERMANENT RELEASE OF FIRM CAPACITY

perturbation.original_text: A.       Replacement Shipper has read and understands the terms and conditions          under which the Releasing Shipper has permanently released such          capacity on Transporter and hereby contracts for such capacity, in          accordance with its bid, subject to terms and conditions set forth on          Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff and the Service Agreement between the          Releasing Shipper and Transporter (copy of bid and release notice          attached). Replacement Shipper adopts such Service Agreement for the          assigned capacity, and from and after the effective date of the          referenced release shall be fully liable to Transporter for all demand          charges, volumetric charges, surcharges, and other charges arising          under the terms of the Service Agreement with Transporter for such          assigned capacity from and after that effective date.
perturbation.changed_text: A.       Replacement Shipper has read the terms and conditions and hereby contracts for such capacity, subject to terms and conditions set forth on Transporter's FERC Gas Tariff and the Service Agreement between the Releasing Shipper and Transporter . Replacement Shipper adopts such Service Agreement for the assigned capacity, and from and after the effective date of the referenced release shall be liable to Transporter for all charges arising under the terms of the Service Agreement with Transporter for such assigned capacity from and after that effective date.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "in accordance with its bid" provides an omission because it disconnects the partial assignment of capacity to the specific bid which includes pricing, volumes, receipt & delivery points, etc., leading to uncertainty about the financial obligations of the Replacement Shipper. Omitting "volumetric charges, surcharges," and specifying that only "all charges" will be applied, also creates ambiguity.
